text: Shin Suk-ju (1417 June 21, 1475) was a Neo-Confucian scholar, politician and diplomat, linguist, and painter during the Joseon Dynasty. His cousin was Deposed Queen Yun. His pen name was Huihyundang (희현당, 希賢堂), Bohanjae (보한재, 保閑齋), Chinese style name was Beomong (범옹, 泛翁). == Writing == * Bohanjaejip(보한재집, 保閑齋集) * Saseongtonggo(사성통고, 四聲通攷) * Nongsanchukmokseo(농산축목서) * Bukjeongrok(북정록 北征錄) * Haedongjegukgi(해동제국기 海東諸國記) ==Related pages== * Deposed Queen Lady Yun * Yeonsangun of Joseon == References == == Other websites == * http://100.naver.com/100.nhn?docid=101950 * http://navercast.naver.com/contents.nhn?contents_id=5967 * http://terms.naver.com/entry.nhn?docId=560358 * http://terms.naver.com/entry.nhn?docId=689523 Category:Korean politicians Category:Asian diplomats Category:Korean painters Category:1417 births Category:1475 deaths
title: Shin Suk-ju
